div.p: Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tenn,
Camp Meade Md.
Dear Ellen:
I received two letters from to day. So I will answer them to night.
I dont know why you havent heard from me more than you have I have written you ever week But some time I have a hard time finding time to write
I am working most day and night and dont have time to even wash my face some days
We get up at 5-15 ever Morning and dont have time to get our close on hardly until we are out in line for Mess(or breakfast) and then back and go to work or drill
Well I have been out for most
an hour getting some equipment It looks just like harness for a horse. We carry all of our blankets dishes and some clean cloths
Oh I wouldnt put that load on a horse, but I have got to put it on my back and walk about 22 miles tomorrow we are going to move again
Are going to Glenburnie Md. about 6 Miles from Baltimore. So we will have to get up early in the morning and walk all the way. Ah some job I have got
If you dont care what you say We are going down there to get rifle practis
I dont know wheather we will get to come back here
or not. Will I dont care I take ever thing easy.
I was talking to the Captin of our Company about getting a pass to come home and he told me there was nothing doing That he thought we would be in France by the 15 of March
I ask him for a pass from the first of March I ask him if I could go now and he said no So I wont get to come home until I go over and get the Kiser
I sure would like to come home and see ever body and especialy you but guess I cant.
I was over in Baltimore Sat night and Sunday I had
some pictures made I will send you one as soon as I get them I had some post cards made but I will wait and send you a good one I sent Esther one of the post cards guess she will show it to you
I am tickled to death to know you are sending Me some cake and candy I will eat it and thank of you all the time I am afraid I will loose it though as I am going to leave here tomorrow
I sure do hate to make that trip but will have to I have the tent all fixed up and have got to go off and leave it

I wont have time to write Aunt Annie to night you tell her I am getting along fine and will write her just as soon as I get a chance I have written her two letters in the last ten days I dont see why she hasnt heard from Me
Well I have just got 15 minutes to get in bed guess I will have to close Add My mail as you have been all the time I guess I will get it I will write you ever time I can find time
With lots of love
James L Dodds
Co. L. 23 Engineers
Camp Meade Md.
